initial_story:
A US Army soldier stationed in South Korea has been detained in Russia, the US military says.

The Russian foreign ministry said the charges were not related to "politics or espionage", but to a "purely domestic crime".

The 34-year-old was not on official travel when he was held on 2 May in the city of Vladivostok, in Russia's Far East.

Sgt Black had been in the process of changing duty stations from South Korea to Fort Cavazos in the US state of Texas, according to a statement from the US Army.

But instead of returning to the US, he travelled through China to Vladivostok for personal reasons, US Army spokeswoman Cynthia Smith said in a statement.

According to Russian media, he was visiting a woman with whom he had a romantic relationship.

The soldier's mother, Melody Jones, confirmed to CBS that he was in Russia visiting his girlfriend.

"Please do not torture him [or] hurt him," Melody Jones said when asked about her message to the Russians.

Sgt Black enlisted as an infantryman in 2008 and was deployed to Iraq in 2009 and Afghanistan in 2013. He was most recently assigned to the Eighth Army, US Forces Korea at Camp Humphreys in South Korea.

He did not request official clearance and the defence department did not authorise his travel to China or Russia, the US Army said. There is no evidence he intended to remain in Russia.

The Russian interior ministry informed the US embassy in Moscow on 3 May that Sgt Black had been arrested a day earlier for theft of personal property.

He is being held at a pre-trial detention facility until his next hearing.

"The Army notified his family and the US Department of State is providing appropriate consular support to the Soldier in Russia," the US Army said in a statement on Monday.

National Security Council spokesman John Kirby told reporters the US is "aware of this case and other matters related to Russia".

At the White House briefing on Monday, Mr Kirby said he could not provide more details.

Russia is holding two other Americans. Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich has been detained since March 2023 on espionage charges.

Former US Marine Paul Whelan was accused of spying and sentenced to 16 years in prison in 2020.

Both men maintain their innocence, and the US government says the charges against them are baseless.
stories: A British businessman has been detained in Morocco, the UK government says. The Moroccan authorities claim the charges are related to a "minor criminal offence" and not a political or espionage matter. The 42-year-old was not on official travel when he was arrested on 10 June in the city of Tangier, in Morocco's northern region. He had travelled to Morocco for personal reasons, the UK government said. According to local reports, he was visiting a friend in the city. The businessman's family has asked for his safe release and has expressed concerns about his treatment. The UK Foreign Office is providing consular support to the detainee and has requested a meeting with the Moroccan authorities to discuss the case. The detainee has been held at a local police station pending a court hearing.

A French artist has been taken into custody in Brazil, the French government confirms. Brazilian authorities claim the charges are related to a "minor administrative infraction" and not a artistic or intellectual property matter. The 35-year-old was not on official business when she was arrested on 15 July in the city of Rio de Janeiro. She had traveled to Brazil for a personal project, the French government said. According to local reports, she was working on a mural in the city's vibrant street art scene. The artist's family has requested her immediate release and has expressed concerns about her working conditions. The French Culture Ministry is providing artistic support to the detainee and has requested a meeting with the Brazilian authorities to discuss the project. The detainee has been held at a local cultural center pending a court hearing.

A Spanish musician has gone missing in Argentina, sparking concerns among her fans and fellow artists. Argentine authorities claim she was last seen leaving a nightclub in the city of Buenos Aires, but her phone and identification were found abandoned on the streets. The 28-year-old was in Argentina to collaborate with local musicians on a new album, and her family believes her disappearance is related to her artistic pursuits. The Spanish Culture Ministry is offering a reward for any information leading to her safe return and is working with Argentine authorities to investigate the disappearance. Meanwhile, the music community is rallying around the missing musician, sharing messages of support and solidarity on social media.

A renowned French chef has vanished in Tokyo, leaving behind a trail of bewildered colleagues and patrons. Japanese authorities report she was last spotted departing a sushi bar in the Shibuya district, but her phone and wallet were discovered discarded on the pavement. The 32-year-old had traveled to Tokyo to collaborate with local chefs on a new culinary project, and her family suspects her disappearance is linked to her passion for gastronomy. The French Ministry of Culture is offering a reward for any information leading to her safe return and is working with Japanese authorities to unravel the mystery.
